entry.title: Re: IGS very broken!
entry.content:
I know maybe is very late to post the solution, but just to documented my case, I had a similar situation in an S/4HANA FPS3 after a system conversion and the issue was caused for a miss configuration in the instance profile; I had to add the following entries:

_IG = ig.sap$(SAPSYSTEMNAME)_$(INSTANCE_NAME)
Execute_xx = local rm -f $(_IG)
Execute_xx = local ln -s -f $(DIR_EXECUTABLE)/igswd_mt $(_IG)
Start_Program_xx = local $(_IG) -mode=profile pf=$(_PF)

and delete the following (because they already existed in the DEFAULT profile):

_ENQ enq.sapSID_DXX
_MS ms.sapSID_DXX
enq/serverhost XXXXXXXXXX
enq/serverinst XX
enq/serverport XXXXX
Execute_09 local rm -f $(_MS)
Execute_10 local ln -s -f $(DIR_EXECUTABLE)$(DIR_SEP)msg_server$(FT_EXE) $(_MS)
Execute_11 local rm -f $(_ENQ)
Execute_12 local ln -s -f $(DIR_EXECUTABLE)$(DIR_SEP)enq_server$(FT_EXE) $(_ENQ)
Start_Program_00 local $(_MS) pf=$(DIR_PROFILE)$(DIR_SEP)SID_DXX_xxxxxxxxxx
Start_Program_01 local $(_ENQ) pf=$(DIR_PROFILE)$(DIR_SEP)SID_DXX_xxxxxxxxxx
Start_Program_02 local $(_DW) pf=$(_PF)

After been do it this adjustment the IGS starts to work again.

Hope this solution works for someone else.

Ruben S√°nchez

entry.title: How to add a custom button to the RichTextEditor Toolbar?
entry.content:
Hi All,

I am very new to Fiori Development and need some help.  I am implementing a Fiori App utilizing the Rich Text Editor.  The application is based on a CDS Data Model to generate a List-Detail experience.  On the Detail Page, a custom section was used to provide the user with the Rich Text Editor to provide formatting, such as Bold, Italic, etc. text which would be saved to a string in the table.  This works perfectly for the text editing.  Now, some custom buttons are required for additional functionality.   However, I have been struggling to add custom buttons to the toolbar.

The fragment definition for the custom section is below.

<core:FragmentDefinition
  xmlns:core="sap.ui.core"
  xmlns="sap.m"
  xmlns:rte="sap.ui.richtexteditor"
>

  <rte:RichTextEditor
    id="_IDGenRichTextEditor"
    value="{LongText}"
    height="300px"
    width="100%"
    required="false"
    editable="true"
    editorType="TinyMCE7" 
    showGroupClipboard="true" 
    showGroupFont="true"
    showGroupInsert="true"
    showGroupLink="true"
    showGroupTextAlign ="true"
  >
  </rte:RichTextEditor>     
</core:FragmentDefinition>

At first, I thought I could set the property for the custom toolbar and add the button in the fragment definition.  This is similar to some of the sample code I found from the documentation.  However, this has not been working for me.  Below is a sample of what I attempted.  

   customToolbar="true" 
    customButtons="{
      path: '/customButtons',
      template: 'sap.m.Button'
    }"
          <richtexteditor:customButtons>
            <Button
                id="myCustomButton"
                text="My Custom Button"
                press=".onMyCustomButtonPress"
            />
        </richtexteditor:customButtons>

 When this did not work, I thought that it would be best to add a Controller Extension to the Object Page.  I tried to model from a solution I found here. Below is a rough idea of what I attempted in the onInit function.  Unfortunately, this did not work for me either.

 var oRichTextEditor = this.getView().byId("_IDGenRichTextEditor");

            var oButton = new sap.m.Button("button", {
						text: "My Button",
						icon: "sap-icon://eraser",
						press: this.onPress.bind(this)
					});

            oRichTextEditor.addCustomButton(oButton);
			sap.ui.getCore().applyChanges();

Can anyone highlight what am I doing wrong?  Is my approach with the Fragment or the Controller Extension wrong?  I would appreciate it if anyone can shed some light on this for me.  Thanks in advance for your help.

John

entry.title: Re: Beginner question
entry.content:
Hello @yasser_fathelbab 

Good to hear you intend starting your SAP journey. Let me walk you through options

No, Business Processes in SAP S4 HANA Portfolio and Project Management is not usually the very first course I would recommend. The reason is that course assumes you already have a good understanding of SAP navigation and basic business processes.

For you as someone new, it would be better if you started with:

  • SAP Learning Journey- Discovering SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. This provides an overview of core business processes and navigation.
  • Then the introduction to SAP, this provides details to basic navigation, terminology and system usage.

Once you become comfortable then you can take the Portfolio and Project Management course. This will enable you dive into the project-specific processes.

Consult the following links for more guidance.

Implementing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Managing SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition Projects

I hope this provides the desired learning nsight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Failed to "Overwrite with Remote Topic Bindings" - S/...
entry.content:
Hello @TanDT 

Thank you for your detailed explanation and the screenshots.

Have a look at Integrating Enterprise Event Enablement for some details.

To summarise, based on your description, the issue you are seeing indicates a mismatch in field length or data type when the event payload is being written to the event table or transferred.

To solve that issue, I recommend:

  • Ensure to review the payload schema for BOM and change master events, then compare it with the expected data structure in you BTP ABAP inbound topic binding. Direct Push-Based Integration & Recommendations for Customers on using the Direct Push-Based Integration
  • If you don‚Äôt need all the fields in the payload, configure an event filter in the binding to avoid problematic fields. Configuring Inbound Event Topic Bindings
  • Consider not adding all BOM and change master events at the same time. Rather test with only one new event.

Finally, you can raise an incident with SAP if the error persists and ensure you attach the runtime error log and payload definition.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.content:
Dear Team,

Thanks & Regards,
Naveen

 

 


------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Learn more about the SAP Support user and program here.

entry.title: Re: Company Code Specific Customer Data Return - Extration
entry.content:
Dear Naveen,

Customer Data Return was primarily designed to fulfil a legal and contractual obligation from SAP to return customer owned data to customer primarily at the time of offboarding. Hence, the app was only built with the original use case in mind and doesn't provide any kind of backup functionality. We also don't have any other feature in S/4HANA Cloud that provides this kind of data.

 

It is not possible to extract company code/country‚Äìwise data using the Customer Data Return app, as it does not support such filter conditions.

Data extraction is performed at the table level, meaning the entire table data is extracted regardless of any specific column values. Currently, there is no option to apply filters (such as company code) while executing the extraction for a table.

You can try to filter the result of the data extracted to fulfill your requirement.

 

Thanks and Best Regards,

Bell

entry.title: Re: How to migrate Rentable Object w/o Portfolio Structur...
entry.content:
Hi @charlene2 

Thank you for your question.

Have a look at Available Migration Objects & Real estate contract       
To summarise, the Rentable Object without portfolio structure is not currently offered as a standalone migration object in public cloud. However, Usable Object is available and it covers the standard use case for migrating real estate master data.

This means that if you need to migrate RW objects, they must be created or maintained manually in the system after migration of usable objects. If this is a hard requirement for your project, consider submitting a customer influence program to SAP.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Depreciation KEY in Chart of Depr. 3710 (NL) does not...
entry.content:
Hi @Pieter_ 

Thank you for your question.

Have you had a look at Asset Accounting Overview & 3593674 - Changing the depreciation key?

Depreciation keys are country specific and preconfigured as part of the charts of the COD. They are based on local accounting and legal requirements. The COD 3710 description key LINE is configured with base 24 and this drives the calculation using remaining NBV instead of the acquisition value. In contrast, COD 2510 key LINE uses base value.  This is because each country version must align with local regulations.

You can consider using Belgium COD for relevant company code if it is legally permitted.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: [Q]311 Transfer Best Practice: Don‚Äôt Mix MIGO with /SCWM/PRDI or /SCWM/PRDO‚ÄîUse Single-Point Posting
entry.content:
Is this paragraph correct? The gist is that you shouldn‚Äôt first create a delivery in MIGO and then execute it in /SCWM/PRDO, but rather perform the operation at a single point.

For a 311 (same-plant storage-location‚Äìto‚Äìstorage-location one-step transfer), define and follow a single-point posting, single source of truth principle: either post the 311 movement in IM via MIGO/Fiori and stop there, or initiate the move in EWM (warehouse task/posting change) and let the system automatically back-post the IM 311‚Äîdo not perform an additional step in /SCWM/PRDI or /SCWM/PRDO after MIGO. The reason is that 311 does not use deliveries and has no PGI/GR chain, while PRDI/PRDO are EWM apps for delivery-based receiving/shipping. Mixing them (e.g., posting in MIGO and then repeating in PRDI/PRDO) easily leads to double/contradictory postings, queue errors, IM‚ÄìEWM stock mismatches, and broken HU/batch traceability. Only when you adopt a delivery-based process (such as an STO or any scenario that requires PGI/GR across locations/plants) should you process PRDO ‚Üí PGI on the issuing side and PRDI ‚Üí GR on the receiving side‚Äîand in that case you should not use 311.

Hello Chris,

Thank you for the detailed suggestion.

However, the issue we're facing is not with the payload sending from Public Cloud to BTP ABAP. In fact, we are stuck at the final steps in the configuration of the event channel.

Specifically, the error occurs while we're doing this step Synchronizing Sender and Receiver Channels | SAP Help Portal.

Basically, we have set up the inbound topic bindings in BTP and now we are synchronizing it to the Outbound Topics Binding in Public Cloud event channel.

According to the document: "The available outbound topics are called from the receiver channel and set up automatically in the sender channel."

Problem is, topics are not set up automatically in the sender channel, because the topic string of Bill of Material Events seems to be longer than the expected data type used in the program behind.

My concern is, this isn't a custom Event, but an SAP published event, I don't expect the topics would be overextended from its given length, wouldn't it?

Or I'm just thinking too much, maybe the data type simply needs to be extended in the program during topic synchronization.

Best Regard,

Tan

entry.title: CON2 Revaluation causes many update processes in the queue
entry.content:
During the month-end closing process in our system, when performing the work order revaluation step‚Äîwhether by executing CON2 or running RKAZCON2 via SE38‚Äîother users are unable to retrieve data after creating and saving documents such as Purchase Orders (PO) and Sales Orders (SO).

Upon investigation, we found that while CON2 is running, a large number of update processes in SM13 remain in the "Initial" status. Processes submitted by other users also in the queue.

We currently need to resolve two issues:

  1. The update processes should not interfere with other users' operations.

  2. After the scheduled background job for CON2 is completed, the UPD process of CON2 does not finish promptly. Instead, the update processes continue for an extended period, delaying the monthly closing timeline.

We have conducted the following analysis for reference:
A few minutes after the process starts, the number of queued processes increases significantly. DB12 reveals that a large number of tables are waiting for locks, and updates to the COSS table are consuming substantial time. Implementing Note 543470 did not yield any improvement.

Has anyone encountered a similar issue?

entry.title: SAP B1/SQL Server 2019 Query Error when entering Parameter
entry.content:
If i use QUERY by not use '[%0]' No Problem

SELECT
B.Bo_Pl_No AS [WMS No.],
X.TransferNo AS [Transfer No.],
CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate) AS [Date],
P.Tp_ItemCode AS [Item No.],
I.ItemName AS [Item Name],
CAST(P.Tp_Qty AS decimal(19,6)) AS [Quantity],
B.Bo_No AS [Box No.]
FROM dbo.TB_Box AS B
JOIN dbo.TB_TempPick AS P ON P.Tp_Box = B.Bo_No
LEFT JOIN OITM AS I ON I.ItemCode = P.Tp_ItemCode
LEFT JOIN (
SELECT
COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)),
CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50))) AS WMSNo,
STRING_AGG(CAST(T.DocNum AS nvarchar(20)), ', ')
WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY T.DocNum) AS TransferNo
FROM OWTR T
JOIN NNM1 S
ON S.Series = T.Series
AND S.ObjectCode = '67'
WHERE T.CANCELED = 'N'
AND S.SeriesName LIKE 'ITS%'
GROUP BY COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)),
CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50)))
) AS X ON CAST(B.Bo_Pl_No AS nvarchar(50)) = X.WMSNo

WHERE
B.Bo_Active = 1
AND P.Tp_Active = 1
AND (ISNULL('','') = '' OR CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate) >= CONVERT(date, ''))
AND (ISNULL('','') = '' OR CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate) <= CONVERT(date, ''))
AND (ISNULL('','') = '' OR B.Bo_Pl_No = '')
AND (ISNULL('','') = '' OR B.Bo_No = '')
ORDER BY
B.Bo_CreateDate, B.Bo_Pl_No, B.Bo_No, P.Tp_ItemCode;

AND S.SeriesName LIKE 'ITS%'
GROUP BY COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)),
CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50)))
) AS X ON CAST(B.Bo_Pl_No AS nvarchar(50)) = X.WMSNo

WHERE
B.Bo_Active = 1
AND P.Tp_Active = 1
AND (ISNULL('[%0]','') = '' OR CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate) >= CONVERT(date, '[%0]'))
AND (ISNULL('[%1]','') = '' OR CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate) <= CONVERT(date, '[%1]'))
AND (ISNULL('[%2]','') = '' OR B.Bo_Pl_No = '[%2]')
AND (ISNULL('[%3]','') = '' OR B.Bo_No = '[%3]')
ORDER BY
B.Bo_CreateDate, B.Bo_Pl_No, B.Bo_No, P.Tp_ItemCode;

entry.title: Re: How to Include Overhead Costs in Product Costing in S...
entry.content:
Hello @MohamedKharbouch 

Thank you for the details.

Have a look at Product Cost Planning & Overhead Calculation for details on your question.

However, in public cloud, overhead costs such as sales and administrations costs are not picked up automatically in the cost estimate of a finished good. You are required to set up and assign overhead groups and overhead costing sheets so that indirect costs are applied during product costing.

The summary of the steps you require to generate the overhead cost include:

  • Define or use overhead costing sheet. Note that this cannot be configured freely like On-premise.
  • Assign overhead group to the material using the change material app.
  • Then the system picks the costing sheet. Finally, you can re-run costing and the overhead calculation should now be included in your cost estimate.

The application you need are Change Material, Manage Product Cost Estimates, Display Cost Estimates (Actual/Planned) and Manage Allocations.

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

Overhead Keys

Costing Sheets

entry.title: Re: Personas 3.0 : How to merge multiple screens into one...
entry.content:
Here it matters what system are you talking about. 

In a recent S/4HANA system, XK03 is a tabbed transaction. You can use tab merging to redesign or even flatten out the screen as you like. Being a display transaction, you should have little problem.

However, if you are on an older ECC system, then XK03 may look completely different and have separate screens in place of the tab strip, so tab merging doesn't apply. In this case, I'm afraid the method would be like you described: Creating custom controls and populating them by a script that navigates to the necessary screens containing the data you are interested in, grabs the values and fills your custom controls.
As an alternative, you may be able to use a BAPI function module call and grab the details you need that way instead of navigating across screens. Then, fill your custom controls from the result of the BAPI.

entry.title: Re: Delta Sync Issue in SSAM 2505 with Basic Authentication
entry.content:
With basic authentication set up as SSO to access the backend, all mobile users will receive the same data set during both initialization and sync (delta).
For those users who are not receiving the latest backend changes through delta sync, I would first verify if they can see the changes on their mobile devices after re-logging into the app (logging out and re-onboarding).

entry.title: Re: SAP B1/SQL Server 2019 Query Error when entering Para...
entry.content:
Hi,

you can't us variables free in a query. SAP needs a field according to your variableit shows the fiedname and uses the field-kind to ask for it.

You can do it like

WHERE
T0.DocDate = '[%0]'

If you need it in your case you can declare a Standard-SQL Variable at he beginning of your query (@DocDate) and use this later in the query like

/**SELECT FROM [OFPR] T0 **/
DECLARE @DocDateFrom AS Date
/* WHERE */
SET @DocDateFrom = /* T0.F_RefDate */ '[%0]'

Select 
*
FROM ORDR
WHERE DocDate = @DocDateFrom

Here some examples

/*Buchungsdatum*/
/**SELECT FROM [OFPR] T0 **/
DECLARE @DocDateFrom AS Date
/* WHERE */
SET @DocDateFrom = /* T0.F_RefDate */ '[%0]'

/**SELECT FROM [OFPR] T1 **/
DECLARE @DocDateTo AS Date
/* WHERE */
SET @DocDateTo = /* T1.T_RefDate */ '[%1]'

-----
/*F√§lligkeitsdatum*/
/**SELECT FROM [OFPR] T0 **/
DECLARE @DocDateFrom AS Date
/* WHERE */
SET @DocDateFrom = /* T0.F_DueDate */ '[%0]'

/**SELECT FROM [OFPR] T1 **/
DECLARE @DocDateTo AS Date
/* WHERE */
SET @DocDateTo = /* T1.T_DueDate */ '[%1]'

-----
/*Belegdatum*/
/**SELECT FROM [OFPR] T0 **/
DECLARE @DocDateFrom AS Date
/* WHERE */
SET @DocDateFrom = /* T0.F_TaxDate */ '[%0]'

/**SELECT FROM [OFPR] T1 **/
DECLARE @DocDateTo AS Date
/* WHERE */
SET @DocDateTo = /* T1.T_TaxDate */ '[%1]'/*Buchungsdatum*/
/**SELECT FROM [OFPR] T0 **/
DECLARE @DocDateFrom AS Date
/* WHERE */
SET @DocDateFrom = /* T0.F_RefDate */ '[%0]'

/**SELECT FROM [OFPR] T1 **/
DECLARE @DocDateTo AS Date
/* WHERE */
SET @DocDateTo = /* T1.T_RefDate */ '[%1]'

-----
/*F√§lligkeitsdatum*/
/**SELECT FROM [OFPR] T0 **/
DECLARE @DocDateFrom AS Date
/* WHERE */
SET @DocDateFrom = /* T0.F_DueDate */ '[%0]'

/**SELECT FROM [OFPR] T1 **/
DECLARE @DocDateTo AS Date
/* WHERE */
SET @DocDateTo = /* T1.T_DueDate */ '[%1]'

-----
/*Belegdatum*/
/**SELECT FROM [OFPR] T0 **/
DECLARE @DocDateFrom AS Date
/* WHERE */
SET @DocDateFrom = /* T0.F_TaxDate */ '[%0]'

/**SELECT FROM [OFPR] T1 **/
DECLARE @DocDateTo AS Date
/* WHERE */
SET @DocDateTo = /* T1.T_TaxDate */ '[%1]'

If you can't find a matching field for you requirements, at least you can setup a UDT and Name the Field as you like/need and take the needed Field-Type.

Sideeffect: When entering values in your UDT in the column, it will be shown as valid values when paramter is prompted

regards Lothar

entry.title: Re: Public Cloud Edition, VAT registration number
entry.content:
Hello @panagiotism 

Thank you for your question.

The reason you don‚Äôt see the Tax category is because Australia does not use VAT Ids in the European sense. It uses the Australian Business Number (ABN) or Australian Registration Number (ARN). The system will therefore not provide the EUXXXXXX format

If you need to store the EU-style number, you will have to maintain it in a custom field and enable it in the business partner master data

Have a look at these links for more details.

Maintaining Tax Numbers for Business Partners

Custom Fields App and Custom Logic App

Maintain Tax Number Categories

Define Tax Number Categories

I hope this provides the desired insight. Happy to answer any further questions.

Best regards

Chris

‰ªäÂπ¥„ÅÆ„Éè„ÉÉ„Ç´„ÇΩ„É≥„ÅÆ„ÉÜ„Éº„Éû„ÅØ„ÄÅ„ÄåSAPÊ•≠Âãô„Å´AI„ÅßSurprise„ÇíÔºÅ„Åù„Çå„ÄÅAI„Å´‰ªª„Åõ„Åæ„Åõ„ÇìÔºü„Äç„Åß„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ„Åì„ÅÆ„ÉÜ„Éº„Éû„Å´„Åä„ÅÑ„Å¶„ÄÅÊúÄÈÅ©„Å™„Çµ„Éó„É©„Ç§„É§ÈÅ∏ÂÆö„ÇíÊîØÊè¥„Åô„Çã„Åü„ÇÅ„ÄÅË™øÈÅîÂàÜÈáé„Å´„Åä„Åë„ÇãÂú∞ÊîøÂ≠¶„É™„Çπ„ÇØ„ÉªÁÇ∫ÊõøÂ§âÂãï„Éª„Çµ„Çπ„ÉÜ„Éä„Éì„É™„ÉÜ„Ç£ÊåáÊ®ô„Å™„Å©„ÅÆÂ§ñÁöÑË¶ÅÂõ†„Çí‰∏ÄÂÖÉÁÆ°ÁêÜ„ÉªËß£Êûê„Åß„Åç„Çã„Ç¢„Éó„É™„Ç±„Éº„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„ÇíÈñãÁô∫„Åó„ÄÅÊò®Âπ¥„Å´Âºï„ÅçÁ∂ö„ÅçË¶ã‰∫ãÊúÄÂÑ™ÁßÄË≥û„Çí2Âπ¥ÈÄ£Á∂ö„ÅßÂèóË≥û„Åï„Çå„ÅüPwC„Ç≥„É≥„Çµ„É´„ÉÜ„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞ÂêàÂêå‰ºöÁ§æ(‰ª•‰∏ã„ÄÅPwC„Ç≥„É≥„Çµ„É´„ÉÜ„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞)‚ÄúPwC„Ç¨„Éº„Éá„Ç£„Ç¢„É≥„Ç∫„ÉÅ„Éº„É†‚Äù„ÅÆÊñπ„ÄÖ„Å´„ÄÅ„ÅäË©±„Çí„Åä‰º∫„ÅÑ„Åó„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ

 

„ÉÅ„Éº„É†/„Ç§„É≥„Çø„Éì„É•„ÉºÂèÇÂä†ËÄÖÁ¥π‰ªã

 

ÂÜôÁúü‰∏äÊÆµÂ∑¶„Åã„Çâ„ÄÅÂêëÂ±±Ê∞è„ÄÅ‰∏≠Â±±Ê∞è„ÄÅÂÆàÁî∞Ê∞è„ÄÅ‰ºäËó§Ê∞è„ÄÅÂ§ßÂ°öÊ∞è„ÄÅÁî∞‰πãÈ†≠Ê∞è

ÂÜôÁúü‰∏ãÊÆµÂ∑¶„Åã„Çâ„ÄÅËçíË≥ÄÊ∞è„ÄÅÂåóÊùëÊ∞è„ÄÅÊµÖÈáéÊ∞è„ÄÅÂ∏ÇÂ∑ùÊ∞è„ÄÅÁ•ûË∞∑Ê∞è„ÄÅ‰∏≠Êæ§Ê∞è

 

„Ç§„É≥„Çø„Éì„É•„Éº„Å´„ÅØ‰ª•‰∏ã„ÅÆ10Âêç„ÅåÂèÇÂä†„Åï„Çå„Åæ„Åó„Åü„ÄÇ

‰∏≠Â±±Ê∞è(„Éá„Ç£„É¨„ÇØ„Çø„Éº)Ôºö„Ç®„É≥„Çø„Éº„Éó„É©„Ç§„Ç∫„Éà„É©„É≥„Çπ„Éï„Ç©„Éº„É°„Éº„Ç∑„Éß„É≥„Ç≥„É≥„Çµ„É´„ÉÜ„Ç£„É≥„Ç∞‰∫ãÊ•≠ÈÉ®‚Äì Enterprise SolutionÊâÄÂ±û„ÄÄS/4HANAÂ∞éÂÖ•„Åù„Åó„Å¶„É™„ÇΩ„Éº„ÇπÁÆ°ÁêÜ„ÇíÊãÖÂΩì„ÄÇÁ¥Ñ15Âπ¥SAPÈñ¢ÈÄ£„ÅÆ‰ªï‰∫ã„Å´Êê∫„Çè„Çã„ÄÇ

Â§ßÂ°öÊ∞è(„Éû„Éç„Éº„Ç∏„É£„Éº)Ôºö„ÉÅ„Éº„É†„É™„Éº„ÉÄ„Éº„ÄÇÂêåÈÉ®ÁΩ≤„Å´„Å¶S/4HANA„ÅÆÊã°Âºµ„Å´Èñ¢„Åó„Å¶BTPÁ≠â„ÇíÁî®„ÅÑ„ÅüÈñãÁô∫„ÇÑÈÅãÁî®„ÇíÊãÖÂΩì„ÄÇÊñ∞Âçí„Åã„ÇâÁ¥Ñ19Âπ¥SAPÈñ¢ÈÄ£„ÅÆ‰ªï‰∫ã„Å´Êê∫„Çè„Çã„ÄÇBTPÊ≠¥„ÅØÁ¥Ñ5Âπ¥„ÄÇSAP Business Technology Platform„ÉÅ„É£„É≥„Éî„Ç™„É≥„ÄÇ

ËçíË≥ÄÊ∞è(„Ç∑„Éã„Ç¢„Ç¢„ÇΩ„Ç∑„Ç®„Ç§„Éà)ÔºöÂêåÈÉ®ÁΩ≤„Å´„Å¶„ÄÅS/4HANA„ÅÆÊã°Âºµ„Å´Èñ¢„Åó„Å¶BTPÁ≠â„ÇíÁî®„ÅÑ„ÅüÈñãÁô∫„ÇÑÈÅãÁî®„ÇíÊãÖÂΩì„ÄÇÁ¥Ñ8Âπ¥SAPÈñ¢ÈÄ£„ÅÆ‰ªï‰∫ã„Å´Êê∫„Çè„Çã„ÄÇBTPÊ≠¥„ÅØÁ¥Ñ4Âπ¥„ÄÇBTP„Éè„ÉÉ„Ç´„ÇΩ„É≥„Å∏„ÅÆÂèÇÂä†„ÅØ3ÂõûÁõÆ„ÄÇ

‰ºäËó§Ê∞è(„Ç∑„Éã„Ç¢„Ç¢„ÇΩ„Ç∑„Ç®„Ç§„Éà)ÔºöÂêåÈÉ®ÁΩ≤„Å´„Å¶„ÄÅSAPÂ∞éÂÖ•√óÁîüÊàêAI„ÅÆÊé®ÈÄ≤„Å´Êê∫„Çè„Çã„ÄÇÁ¥Ñ3Âπ¥SAPÈñ¢ÈÄ£„ÅÆ‰ªï‰∫ã„Å´Êê∫„Çè„Çã„ÄÇBTP„ÅÆÁµåÈ®ì„ÅØ„Åª„Å®„Çì„Å©„Çº„É≠„ÄÇBTP„Éè„ÉÉ„Ç´„ÇΩ„É≥„Å∏„ÅÆÂèÇÂä†„ÅØ2ÂõûÁõÆ„ÄÇ

ÂÆàÁî∞Ê∞è(„Ç¢„ÇΩ„Ç∑„Ç®„Ç§„Éà)ÔºöÂêåÈÉ®ÁΩ≤„Å´„Å¶„ÄÅS/4HANA„ÄÅBTPÂ∞éÂÖ•„ÇíÊãÖÂΩì„ÄÇÊñ∞Âçí„Åã„ÇâÁ¥Ñ3Âπ¥SAPÈñ¢ÈÄ£„ÅÆ‰ªï‰∫ã„Å´Êê∫„Çè„Çã„ÄÇBTP„Éè„ÉÉ„Ç´„ÇΩ„É≥„Å∏„ÅÆÂèÇÂä†„ÅØ‰ªäÂõû„ÅåÂàù„ÇÅ„Å¶„ÄÇ

Á•ûË∞∑Ê∞è(„Ç∑„Éã„Ç¢„Ç¢„ÇΩ„Ç∑„Ç®„Ç§„Éà)ÔºöÂêåÈÉ®ÁΩ≤„Å´„Å¶„ÄÅS/4HANAÂ∞éÂÖ•‰ºÅÊ•≠„ÅÆÂ∞éÂÖ•Âæå„ÅÆ„Éï„Ç©„É≠„Éº„ÄÅÈÅãÁî®Ë®≠ÂÆö„Åù„Åó„Å¶ÂÆüÊñΩÊ•≠Âãô„ÇíÊãÖÂΩì„ÄÇÊñ∞Âçí„Åã„ÇâÁ¥Ñ3Âπ¥SAPÈñ¢ÈÄ£„ÅÆ‰ªï‰∫ã„Å´Êê∫„Çè„Çã„ÄÇBTP„ÇíÁî®„ÅÑ„Çã„Åì„Å®„ÄÅBTP„Éè„ÉÉ„Ç´„ÇΩ„É≥„Å´ÂèÇÂä†„Åô„Çã„Åì„Å®„ÅØ‰ªäÂõû„ÅåÂàù„ÇÅ„Å¶„ÄÇ

entry.title: Re: TRM Fields in app Display Line Items in General Ledge...
entry.content:
Hello @FabioGG 

Thanks for the question. Here is what might be possible and how to proceed.

What you should do
Display Line Items in General Ledger (App ID F2217) is developed using the CDS view C_JournalEntryItemBrowser and primarily presents fields from ACDOCA. Additional fields from related views may be incorporated if the association is 0-1 or 1-1

How to add fields key-user extensibility?
If the TRM fields you need are part of ACDOCA or an eligible association of C_JournalEntryItemBrowser, you can add them via Custom Fields and Logic:

Create the custom fields in the business context Journal Entry Item (or relevant GL context).

Enable usage for the app Display Line Items in General Ledger (F2217).

Publish and then add the fields via the app‚Äôs column settings. SAP Help Portal-Custom Fields for Journal Entries Used in G/L Accounting

Known limitation: App ID F2217 does not display fields that only exist in BSEG/BKPF, that is, App ID F2218 Display Line Item Entry. If a field appears in F2218 but not in F2217, it‚Äôs because F2217 reads ACDOCA (and specific associations), while F2218 reads BSEG/BKPF. SAP Support Portal-2699769 - Field Display in app Display Line Items in General Ledger


The listed fields, such as YY1_FinancialInstrCharact and YY1_TermStartDate, use the YY1 namespace (custom). To display them in F2217, they must either be persisted on ACDOCA or an associated view, eligible as per the above, and enabled for F2217 via Custom Fields and Logic.


If they are stored only in TRM tables that are not linked to C_JournalEntryItemBrowser with 0-1 or 1-1 cardinality, they won‚Äôt be accessible in F2217 by default. In such cases, consider a data-source extension where supported or using an alternative reporting application built on a CDS view that includes those TRM attributes. SAP Support Portal-3218239 - Display Line Items in General Ledger is not showing Submitter, Approver, Reviewer


If you attempt to add such fields in Display Line-Item Entry F2218, be aware that this app is not registered for extensibility. The suggested approach is to extend F2217 instead, as explained above. SAP Support Portal-3427372 - Unable to add the custom fields in "Display Line Item Entry" app - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Let me know how it goes

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Collaborative Notification - One notification, shared visibility, faster outcomes.
entry.content:
No company is an island!!!

Our vision is a world where every asset runs reliably because Operators, Contractors, and OEMs collaborate seamlessly on a single trusted network. By connecting all parties in one shared platform, we make it easier to coordinate maintenance activities, share real-time status updates, and quickly address issues. This seamless collaboration reduces communication gaps, accelerates decision-

making, and ensures that every asset performs at its best ‚Äî delivering reliability and efficiency across operations.

The new Collaborative Notification feature brings this vision to life by providing shared network statuses within notifications. Instead of relying on scattered emails and chats, operators, contractors, and OEMs now gain a structured, integrated view of each maintenance activity‚Äôs progress directly in the existing notification screens. This makes it easy to identify rejected or completed work that requires follow-up, ensures faster alignment across teams, and drives more efficient, transparent maintenance execution ‚Äî turning seamless collaboration from a goal into a daily reality.

Here‚Äôs a storyboard illustrating how the Collaborative Notification works.

Personas

 

 

Issue Detection and Reporting

 

 

Execution & Post-Work Review

Within SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration, we have also introduced a new status concept to track the full life cycle of maintenance notifications. This enhancement significantly improves our ability to monitor, manage, and facilitate collaboration over the network, providing greater transparency and driving better overall performance.

Initiation Phase

During the Initiation phase, an operator creates a maintenance notification for a piece of equipment or a functional location, and then shares it with the Service Contractor.

Once shared, the notification becomes available on the BNAC tenant of the service contractor, where the Service Planner can view all incoming requests and proceed to the next phase: screening.

At this stage, the notification is automatically assigned an initial status of ‚ÄòOpen‚Äô, indicating that it is ready for further processing.

Screening Phase

During the Screening phase, the Service Planner thoroughly reviews all open maintenance notifications, carefully assessing the details of each request. They can set the status to ‚ÄòIn Review‚Äô while the evaluation is in progress.

Following the review, the planner can either ‚ÄòAccept‚Äô the notification or ‚ÄòReject‚Äô it if additional information is needed. Accepted notifications are marked ‚ÄòAccepted‚Äô, while rejected notifications are marked ‚ÄòRejected‚Äô and returned to the originator for follow-up.

Completion Phase

During the Completion phase, the Service Planner informs the Maintenance Planner that issue resolution is in progress and sets the notification status to ‚ÄòIn Process‚Äô.

Once the work is completed, the status is updated to ‚ÄòCompleted‚Äô. The Maintenance Planner then reviews and verifies the information provided. If all details are correct and satisfactory, they set the status to ‚ÄòConfirmed‚Äô.

This structured approach ensures a smooth, transparent, and accountable process for all parties involved.

 

Action & Statuses

 

Action

Status

Status Method

List of Next Statuses

List of Permitted Previous Statuses

-

Open

Automatic

In Review, Accepted, Rejected

 

Reviewing

In Review

Manual

Accepted, Rejected

Rejected

Accept

Accepted

Manual

Rejected, In Progress, Completed

In Review, Rejected

Reject

Rejected

Manual

In Review, Accepted

In Review, Accepted, In Progress, Completed

Start Work

In Progress

Manual

Rejected, Completed

Accepted

Mark as Complete

Completed

Manual

Confirmed(to be set by operator)

In Progress, Accepted

Confirm

Confirmed

Manual

<None>

Completed

 

Rules

The following rules apply to display the relevant status buttons:

  • When a notification is shared with the service provider only Review and Accept buttons are visible.
  • If the notification is set to In Review, then the said button is disabled.
  • If the notification is accepted, the Review and Accept buttons are disabled.
  • Reject button is always enabled.
  • If the notification is rejected, all the other status buttons are enabled again.
  • The Start Work button is enabled only after the notification is accepted.
  • All the status buttons except Confirm and Reject are disabled once the notification is set to Mark as Complete or Completed state.

 

 

Why it Matters?

Companies must maximize asset utilization to minimize costly downtimes which lead to revenue loss. The SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration solution provides a digital platform to connect operations and the asset management ecosystem for collaborative asset lifecycle management. It enables consistent visibility, transparency and resiliency through a shared platform for work order collaboration with Service Contractors & Suppliers for efficiency and  accuracy from work planning to execution.

The Value of Business Network Asset Collaboration

  • Improve asset data accuracy & completeness- Remove the data silos and collaborating on a common model taxonomy and create a consistent understanding
  • Improve wrench time- Provide centralized access to all maintenance information with continuous collaboration among asset ecosystem partners
  • Reduce maintenance data management costs- Improve efficiency of data handover from asset owners to service providers and reduce data maintenance and validation
  • Reduce unplanned downtime or outages- Enable effective collaboration between the operator and service provider on equipment failures and maintenance performance
  • Improve customer satisfaction- Manage of the full customer lifecycle from maintenance planning, scheduling, execution, and customer service

How do I decide whether this is a solution for me?

  • Do I work with external business partners?

  • Do I want to give access of those partners directly on my ERP?

  • Do I really want to build my own portals and also accept TCO? 

  • Do I have only one level of business partners or it could be many to many relationships?

If you are looking for

A centralized access to all maintenance information with continuous collaboration among asset ecosystem partners (operators / OEMs/ Parts Suppliers/ External Contractors/ Sub-Contractors) without giving access to your ERP. It's as simple as just sending a connection request to get the ball rolling.

Multi-tier connectivity with your partners across the supply chain simplified with multi ERP support and API extensibility.

This is the solution for you.

FAQ's

  • How can I ensure the security of my data on the Network?

You have complete ownership and control of what you share, at what granularity and with whom. Every member on the network has complete transparency and visibility of their data.

  • Could I use this capability even if I have not yet started my S4 transformation?

Yes, we support both ECC & S/4Hana. Here are the details about the supported versions.

  • What if I use 3rd Party solutions? Could I still connect to SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration?

Yes, you can connect using our extensive coverage of REST APIs. Here are the details.

  • Where can I find out more details about SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration?

Here you will find all the relevant details.

  • Where can I find out more details about how Business Network Asset Collaboration fits into Acquire-2-Decommission process?

Here you will find all the relevant details.

  • How can I get started?

Talk to SAP about SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration.

Submit innovation requests

We encourage you to visit the SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration Customer Influence Portal to submit your innovation request...

For further questions and feedback related to the blog, please check the Q&A area and feel free to post your questions in the link with the tag SAP Business Network Asset Collaboration.

We hope you enjoy these new capabilities. Thanks for reading the blog post and Stay tuned!

Follow me on LinkedIn

entry.title: Re: Approach for a multi-site customer service
entry.content:
Hi,

I finally found a solution that works well and allows me to add new sites with different configurations. The steps I followed were:

  • Create a new group similar to the existing ones for Customer Service. Instead of using customersupportagentgroup, create {my_site}customersupportagentrole.
  • Associate this new role with a new backoffice role. Instead of using customersupportagentrole, create a new {my_site}customersupportagentrole.
  • This new backoffice role has authorities: associate it with the OOTB group (e.g., customersupportagentrole).
  • Create a new extension, where we create the perspective-view-switcher with the new role and associate it with the OOTB view.
  • We also create our cs-explorer-tre for the new role.
  • Important: The new group ({my_site}customersupportagentrole) must have permissions for the data types.
  • Once this is done, with the new group, we can customize the screens.

Best regards

entry.title: Future-proof your SAP support journey with Support Accreditation
entry.content:
Discover what‚Äôs new in the Support Accreditation 2025 release

In today‚Äôs fast-paced business environment, speed and resilience are critical. Organizations that fully leverage their SAP solutions are better positioned to overcome challenges swiftly, avoid disruptions, and generate long-term value. That‚Äôs where Support Accreditation comes in ‚Äî your guided path to mastering SAP‚Äôs intelligent support capabilities.

Support Accreditation is a free, self-enabled learning journey that empowers SAP customers, partners, and employees with the requisite knowledge of SAP‚Äôs support offerings and tools. The latest six-unit accreditation is designed to equip all SAP users when engaging with support from SAP.

Support Accreditation learning journey on learning.sap.com

 

Why Support Accreditation Matters

Support Accreditation offers a quick, easy, and impactful way to upskill through a structured learning journey - empowering you and your teams to stay ahead. Here‚Äôs how it delivers impact:

  • Maximize Your SAP Investment: Learn how to unlock the full value of your SAP solutions by leveraging support resources for faster, more effective problem-solving.
  • Resolve Issues Proactively: Prevent disruptions and avoid escalations using self-service tools and real-time support capabilities.
  • Stay Ahead with Intelligent Support: Get familiar with SAP‚Äôs AI-driven and predictive support technologies to stay on the cutting edge.
  • Streamline Support Interactions: Reduce back-and-forth by understanding how to navigate SAP‚Äôs support channels and escalate efficiently.
  • Earn a Recognized Accreditation: Validate your knowledge with an official digital badge that demonstrates your expertise.
  • Follow Scenario-Based Learning Paths: Access tailored guidance for SAP Concur, Procurement, and explore key tools like SAP Cloud ALM.

Learning journey is easy to consume with relevant screenshots and walkthrough videos

Interactive yet easy quizzes for quick knowledge checks

 

What‚Äôs New in the Latest 2025 Release

The 2025 update to Support Accreditation introduces powerful new content designed to help you get even more from your SAP support tools and services. With the latest release, we have streamlined and updated the content to include the latest most relevant information while also introducing new units that can enhance your support services utilization and experience. Here's what‚Äôs new:

entry.title: Understanding the Key Differences Between OData V2 and OData V4 for SAP Integration
entry.content:
OData (Open Data Protocol) is a standard for building and consuming RESTful APIs. It is used extensively in SAP for integrating with various applications and services. OData V2 and OData V4 are two versions of this protocol, each with its own set of features, improvements, and differences.

Here‚Äôs a comparison of OData V2 and OData V4 in a table format, specifically focusing on their usage within SAP:

FeatureoData v2oData v4
Specification VersionOData V2 (released in 2012)OData V4 (released in 2014)
ProtocolBased on OData 2.0 specification.Based on OData 4.0 specification.
Metadata FormatXML metadata format (older style)JSON and XML metadata formats (JSON preferred).
Batch ProcessingSupports batch processing but has limitations.More advanced batch processing and more flexible.
Entity SetsLimited to predefined entity sets.Flexible support for entity sets and navigation.
Query OptionsSupports basic query options like $filter, $orderby.Supports more advanced query options like $search, $apply.
Filters and QueriesLimited support for complex filters and queries.Better support for advanced filtering, ordering, and expression.
Complex TypesComplex types are supported, but limited.Enhanced support for complex types and navigation properties.
Type SystemLimited support for data types (Primitive Types).More advanced and flexible data types system (e.g., Geography types).
Key Concepts (Entity/Key)Key concepts like Entity Key, Navigation Properties are similar to V4 but more limited.Supports more complex key concepts and relationships.
Support for Media ResourcesSupports media resources, but with fewer capabilities.Improved handling of media resources (e.g., files, images).
VersioningLimited versioning capabilities.Better versioning support for services.
Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS)Basic CORS support.Enhanced support for CORS to better handle cross-domain requests.
Backward CompatibilitySupports backward compatibility with previous versions of OData.Limited backward compatibility with OData V2.
Error HandlingStandard error handling.More granular error handling, with better support for custom error codes.
Service Implementation (SAP)Older SAP systems (SAP Gateway, SAP Netweaver).Modern SAP Cloud Platform, SAP Fiori, SAP S/4HANA, and SAP Cloud Integration.

 

Example: Creating a simple OData service in SAP

OData V2 Example:

  1. Define an OData service in SAP Gateway.
  2. Create Entity Sets for "Customers", "Orders", etc.
  3. Query like:
    GET /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZCUSTOMER_SRV/Customers

OData V4 Example:

  1. Define an OData V4 service in SAP (e.g., using SAP Cloud Platform or S/4HANA).
  2. Create Entity Sets and define more flexible navigation paths (e.g., Customers(1)/Orders).
  3. Query like:
    GET /sap/opu/odata/sap/ZCUSTOMER_SRV/Customers?$expand=Orders

Key Differences:

  • Versioning & Flexibility: OData V4 has a more flexible query language and allows for more complex queries, such as $expand and $apply for aggregations or transformations.
  • Support for JSON: OData V4 promotes JSON as the primary metadata format, whereas OData V2 is more XML-centric.
  • Error Handling: In OData V4, error handling is more detailed and provides better customization, which is crucial in modern API architectures.

When to Use:

  • OData V2: Suitable for legacy systems or if you are working with older SAP implementations that do not support OData V4.
  • OData V4: Recommended for newer systems like SAP Fiori, SAP S/4HANA, or when you need to leverage advanced features like enhanced filtering, querying, and better error management

entry.title: Re: SAP B1/SQL Server 2019 Query Error when entering Para...
entry.content:
In SSMS Work in SAP B1 Not Work

DECLARE @DateFrom DATE
SET @DateFrom = '2025-07-01'
DECLARE @DateTo DATE
SET @DateTo ='2025-08-01'
SELECT
    B.Bo_Pl_No                       AS [WMS No.],
    X.TransferNo                     AS [Transfer No.],
    CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate)   AS [Date],
    P.Tp_ItemCode                    AS [Item No.],
    I.ItemName                       AS [Item Name],
    CAST(P.Tp_Qty AS decimal(19,6))  AS [Quantity],
    B.Bo_No                          AS [Box No.]
FROM dbo.TB_Box B
JOIN dbo.TB_TempPick P ON P.Tp_Box = B.Bo_No
LEFT JOIN OITM I ON I.ItemCode = P.Tp_ItemCode
LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT
        COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)), CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50))) AS WMSNo,
        STRING_AGG(CAST(T.DocNum AS nvarchar(20)), ', ') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY T.DocNum) AS TransferNo
    FROM OWTR T
    JOIN NNM1 S ON S.Series = T.Series AND S.ObjectCode = '67'
    WHERE T.CANCELED = 'N'
      AND S.SeriesName LIKE 'ITS%'
    GROUP BY COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)), CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50)))
) X ON CAST(B.Bo_Pl_No AS nvarchar(50)) = X.WMSNo
WHERE
    B.Bo_Active = 1
    AND P.Tp_Active = 1
    AND (@DateFrom IS NULL OR @DateTo IS NULL
         OR (B.Bo_CreateDate >= @DateFrom AND B.Bo_CreateDate < DATEADD(DAY,1,@DateTo)))
ORDER BY
    B.Bo_CreateDate, B.Bo_Pl_No, B.Bo_No, P.Tp_ItemCode;

DECLARE @DateFrom DATE
SET @DateFrom = '[%0]'
DECLARE @DateTo   DATE
SET @DateTo ='[%1]'
SELECT
    B.Bo_Pl_No                       AS [WMS No.],
    X.TransferNo                     AS [Transfer No.],
    CONVERT(date, B.Bo_CreateDate)   AS [Date],
    P.Tp_ItemCode                    AS [Item No.],
    I.ItemName                       AS [Item Name],
    CAST(P.Tp_Qty AS decimal(19,6))  AS [Quantity],
    B.Bo_No                          AS [Box No.]
FROM dbo.TB_Box B
JOIN dbo.TB_TempPick P ON P.Tp_Box = B.Bo_No
LEFT JOIN OITM I ON I.ItemCode = P.Tp_ItemCode
LEFT JOIN (
    SELECT
        COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)), CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50))) AS WMSNo,
        STRING_AGG(CAST(T.DocNum AS nvarchar(20)), ', ') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY T.DocNum) AS TransferNo
    FROM OWTR T
    JOIN NNM1 S ON S.Series = T.Series AND S.ObjectCode = '67'
    WHERE T.CANCELED = 'N'
      AND S.SeriesName LIKE 'ITS%'
    GROUP BY COALESCE(CAST(T.U_wmsno AS nvarchar(50)), CAST(T.U_plateno AS nvarchar(50)))
) X ON CAST(B.Bo_Pl_No AS nvarchar(50)) = X.WMSNo
WHERE
    B.Bo_Active = 1
    AND P.Tp_Active = 1
    AND (@DateFrom IS NULL OR @DateTo IS NULL
         OR (B.Bo_CreateDate >= @DateFrom AND B.Bo_CreateDate < DATEADD(DAY,1,@DateTo)))
ORDER BY
    B.Bo_CreateDate, B.Bo_Pl_No, B.Bo_No, P.Tp_ItemCode;

entry.title: Re: SPL check in transactions vs Master data transfer.
entry.content:
Why again do we need to do SPL check and Embargo check on Transactions?
- In the documents you see from where to where the transaction goes. So the system will know, if a legal regulation is valid and a block of the BP is relevant (SPL) or a country-block (Embargo)
- You can change address data of Business Partners in a document -> then a new SPL check is necessary, otherwise the system just check, what is in the BP-Master-Data.

Would the GTS system not have already blocked suspicious customer names and embargoed countries ?

- Business Partners are blocked before - you can see this in the Master Data of the BP
- Embargoed countries are checked on transactional level.
